company: Paper Plane Design Solutions Pvt. Ltd.
description:
Total years of Experience: 4 to 6 Years
About Us
PaperPlane is a UX Design Solutions Agency focused on combining user centered design with cutting edge technology to deliver compelling experiences that moves markets and transforms businesses for more than 22 years. We are committed to building world-class digital products and experiences in an environment where designers and engineers love to work.
PaperPlane has proudly followed and stood by its mission statement of No Mediocrity through its journey. Our team is small, tightly-knit and every member closely supports the others. We find this expands the broad set of skills the team possesses.
The Opportunity
As a Senior Full Stack Developer, you will interact with an Agile team of other developers, designers, testers and product managers to architect and create awesome web products. We are looking for someone with a passion for technology, a self-motivated and results oriented individual with the ability to work effectively with other team members.
PaperPlane is right for you, if you can…

 4+ years of experience on Full Stack Javascript with very strong Backend Programming skills in Node.js and expertise in React/Vue/Angular Frameworks (preferably React)


 A Strong understanding of Data modeling and 3+ years of experience in any SQL or NoSQL Database


 Extensive hands-on experience developing and deploying large web applications.


 A thorough understanding of and demonstrated experience with Javascript fundamentals and development paradigms. Frameworks are great to work with, but you should be able to function without them.


 A solid understanding of how the web works − REST, Web Security, Traditional Web Pages and SPAs.


 Experience using browser APIs and manipulating the DOM. Converting designs into working code should be second nature to you.


 A keen eye for identifying performance bottlenecks and preventing them preemptively.


 Possess excellent analytical and troubleshooting skills, with the ability to translate your solutions to code.


 A solid understanding of Git with experience in branch and merge as well as pull requests.


 Ability to write good, useful unit tests.


 Fearless ability to identify bottlenecks in design and provide feedback on usability.


 Familiarity with UI patterns will help.


 Familiarity with modern front-end build pipelines and tools.


 Experience with common front-end development tools such as Babel, Webpack, NPM.


 Be ready to work in an environment of perfection and compliance to standards and high design quality benchmarks.

Other responsibilities include…Technical Design

 Requirement Analysis, estimation and technical solution architecture.
 Finalizing user task flows and application logic with inputs from the various teams.
 Communicating overall implications of your proposed solutions.
 Interact with the Designer / Design Team during the design process to finalize interaction. flows and provide insight into technological limitations & possibilities
 Adopting a Sprint based development methodology and be deeply involved with Sprint Planning and Release Management

Technical Process Supervision

 Ensure Process adherence by the Engineering team across all phases of each Project while capturing the uniqueness with each Project Delivery Process.
 Interact closely with internal & external resources through the entire development / production / testing cycle .
 Suggest usability enhancements in the context of the workflow and interactions as they get built out by conducting regular progress reviews in the form of feature-based demos.
 Ensuring the Engineering Team consistently meets Timelines & Quality Standards.
 Identify and implement regular process optimisation initiatives.
 Conduct regular Performance Audits & recommend Performance improvement measures.

Training and Mentoring

 Create training materials and programs for internal teams to aid in their skills growth.
 Conduct regular training workshops with technology / engineering / product/project teams, educating them on best practices and techniques in Web Technologies.
 Mentor Engineering Team members with emphasis on helping you perform more effectively.
 Identify areas of strength & areas of improvements in team members and assign tasks accordingly.
 Maintain an awareness of industry trends, business conditions and internal processes and practice to ensure the success of programs and initiatives.

You’ll be a good fit if…

 Can express your love for programming and impress us by demonstrating real world projects you have built.
 Bang out quality code, built quickly, efficiently, and by adopting programming best practices.
 Are thrilled at the prospect of creating innovative products with a global reach.
 Consider work as fun - a passion to learn and build things you can feel proud of.
 Aspire for excellence and are not satisfied with being just good enough.
 You own what you code - even the bugs you create.
 You have excellent verbal and written communication skills.
 You possess excellent analytical and troubleshooting skills.
 You are a flexible, self-starter & who enjoys solving problems and technical challenges.
 You are a team player with passion – you understand, respect and honour personal & cultural differences.
 You have a fearless ability to jump lower in the stack to solve important problems.
 Strong organizational and time management skills – know what you need to do, and DO IT!
 You enjoy working in a Collaborative environment.
 Are keen to develop your own skills and extend your influence.

Additional brownie points if you have…

 Experience with AWS.
 Experience in Jest.
 Experience in developing a Cloud Product.
 Made Open-source contributions.

If this is you, than we want you to board, Paper Plane.What You’ll love about PaperPlane:

 Medical and Accident Insurance.
 Travel Reimbursements.
 Work From Home until pandemic conditions pass.
 Team Lunches & Outings when we can all meet again :)
 Annual offsite with team building and fun activities somewhere outside town.
 Casual, yet professional and collaborative working environment and an open door policy.
 Fun Friday’s - our very own wind down program for the week.
 Self-directed projects and freedom to pursue RnD.
 Brush up your presentation skills by presenting your Fundae – our monthly company-wide Knowledge Sharing Sessions Fun @ Work (Celebrating Festivals, Birthday & Work Anniversaries)
 Huge scope for personal growth and progression – we embrace your professional development goals and facilitate learning in your passionate areas

We provide technology solutions and business services including finance, accounting, legal, benefits, procurement, tax, real estate, treasury and risk management to help Publicis Groupe agencies do what they do best: create and innovate for their clients.
  In addition to providing essential, everyday services to our agencies, Re:Sources develops and implements platforms, applications and tools to enhance productivity, encourage collaboration and enable professional and personal development. We continually transform to keep pace with our ever-changing communications industry and thrive on a spirit of innovation felt around the globe. With our support, Publicis Groupe agencies continue to create and deliver award-winning campaigns for their clients.
 
 

 Job Description
  Position title:
 
  Node JS Architect (Manager Technology)
  Department:
 
  Enterprise Applications Services
  Location:
 
  Position has a global remit
  Reports to (role):
 
  Senior Manager Technology
 
  Main purpose:
 
 
   Be the direct contact for internal clients for all technical aspects during the initial engagement and kick-off stages of application development projects. Have the ability to drive high level solution architecture design (conceptual, logical, physical)

   Provide knowledge on full-scale continuous delivery process & solutions and understand continuous integration and automated tests (unit, front-end, load) frameworks, scripts and other artefacts created by engineers and be able to support the systems evolution as and when necessary.
   Be responsible for the setup, continuous maintenance, monitoring and troubleshooting of development/ testing/ staging and production environments across internal clients accounts in collaboration with the technology team.
 
  Dimensions:
  Employees managed:

  Indirect: 0
  Key responsibilities:
 
  The key accountabilities for this role are, but not limited to;
 
 
   Ability to develop technical solutions and share with client & team

  The technical team is appropriately mentored.

Title: Sr. DevOps & Cloud Ops engineer 

Location: Bangalore 

Experience: 3 - 6 years 

 
Job Responsibilities:
 Oversee technical mandates from the Engineering, Platform or Software Architect. 
Act as the main driver for the DevOps roadmap, including identifying the technical and business activities needed to support the transition of applications and infrastructure services from development to production. 
Collaborate with various people in the development and infrastructure team (leads, architects, and project managers) to make sure that the Release Management process responds and adheres to the best delivery practices. 
Be a reference and provide guidance for all technical topics in your field of expertise. 
Be proactive in suggesting enhancements and technological choices in your field of expertise. 
Should take active participation in Agile development scrum methodology with the engineering team. 
Subject-matter expert in Release Management, Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery. 
Responsible for producing deployment run books and Implementation plans 
Work with release engineers to understand impacts of branches and code merges. 
Responsible for providing tool awareness and services to help product management and project teams manage and deploy releases into production. 
Responsible for developing and delivering scripts and automation tools used to build, integrate, and deploy software releases to various platforms. 
Ensure that the roles and responsibilities are understood and clear amongst everyone. 

 
Requirements & Skill set:
 Experience using Azure DevOps services, setting up repos, Boards, Artifacts, Test cases, release and deploy pipelines. 
Experience in integration of Azure DevOps with other third party tools. 
Good experience and understanding on source code Management tools mainly GIT including branching strategies, pre post commit hooks. 
Experience in basic Linux administration 
Experience with at least one CI tool (GitLab, Jenkins, Azure pipeline). 
Experience using scripting languages (shell, Python, PowerShell). 
Experience with mainstream logging, monitoring, and tracing tools. 
Experience in automation to ease day to day tasks. 
Good understanding of distributed builds and parallel deployments. 
Experience and expertise in using Azure cloud services. Azure certification will be a plus. 
Experience in using Azure services such as ADLS Gen 2, Azure Functions, Azure messaging services, Azure SQL Server, Azure Key Vault, Azure Cognitive services etc. 
Familiarity using private endpoints/private links. 
Very good understanding of Azure authentication, authorization, service principals, identity, and Access Management. 
Experience OR knowledge to implement and deployment of Docker & Kubernetes on Azure Environment. 
In-depth knowledge of the Microsoft platform (IIS, .NET, Web Services, SQL Server, SharePoint, Windows Server, Clustering, Active Directory etc.). 
If you think you have what it takes to be part of this exciting journey, apply now and become part of a highly successful and motivated team!!

Job Description
This is a remote position.
ThirdEye Data is looking to hire Data Engineers who can develop and maintain data infrastructure. Ability to write, deploy and maintain software to build, integrate, manage, maintain, and quality-assure data for our client. We are looking for someone who can collaborate with their business stakeholders, Data Managers, Data Scientists, Software Engineers and Architects. We expect Data Engineers to own the end-to-end technical data lifecycle and corresponding data technology stack for their data domain and to have a deep understanding of the clients' technology stack.

 Develop, operate and maintain our clients' data pipeline & infrastructure

 You utilize deep understanding of business operations and commercial factors to support decision-making in immediate scope. You record and track data related spend against activities in your immediate scope, including an activity and/or a service.
 You foster a culture that enables our clients' Data & Analytics values.

 A BS or MS degree in Computer Science or Computer Engineering, or equivalent experience

 Experience with SQL and relational databases such as Postgres or MySQL
 Experience developing and deploying applications on Linux infrastructure
 Experience with ML and DeepLearning
 Experience with cloud servers, AWS, Azure & GCP

Introduction
   As a Service Delivery Specialist, you are the face of IBM for our customers. Your clients' success depends on your ability to understand their needs and respond to requests for new services. This role is an integral part of both account planning and delivering support strategies, working to proactively monitor problems, change processes, and handle issues to ensure our customers success.
   
   
  Your Role and Responsibilities
   As a Security Delivery Specialist-SOC ,you are responsible for managing day to day operations of Security Device Management SIEM, Arcsight, Qradar, incident response, threat hunting, Use case engineering, SOC analyst, device integration with SIEM.
   Come join our team of IBM experts, who are leaders with vision, distinguished engineers and IT architects who have worked with thousands of clients to transform enterprise IT, migrate to cloud, apply automation and ensure business continuity. We help client run their IT better, accelerate innovation and deliver unmatched performance with the power automation.
   If you thrive in a dynamic, reciprocal workplace, IBM provides an environment to explore new opportunities every single day. And if you relish the freedom to bring creative, thoughtful solutions to the table, there's no limit to what you can accomplish here. 
  Responsibilities 
  
   Responsible for SOC tools operation and maintenance, administration of underlying Operating system platforms such as Windows, Linux platforms.
    Person Will be responsible for Incident Validation, Incident Analysis, Solution Recommendation, Resolve Escalations, Maintain Knowledge base/play book creation. Rule base Management, General SOC Administration, Resolve user queries.
    Log source integration and troubleshooting
    Manage and guide L1 resources
    Incident Triage - incident classification and prioritization.
    Incident response by escalating qualified incidents to SOC Incharge.
    Preparing Incident Dashboard and Health check dashboards
    Periodic Patch updation and system upgrades
    Willing to work in 24/7 operations and project support activities 
  
   
   
  Required Technical and Professional Expertise
   
  
    2+ Years’ experience in Security Operation centre with SIEMs.
    Person should have IBM Qradar, Forcepoint DLP, Smokescreen Deception, ANT-APT hands-on experience. 
   Working knowledge of industry standard risk, governance and security standard methodologies
    Proficient in incident response processes - detection, triage, incident analysis, remediation and reporting
    Competence with Microsoft Office, e.g. Word, PowerPoint, Excel, Visio, etc. 
   Ability to multitask and work independently with minimal direction and maximum accountability. 
  
   
   
  Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise
   
  
    One or more security certifications: CEH, Security+, GSEC, GCIH, etc.,
    You love collaborative environments that use agile methodologies to encourage creative design thinking and find innovative ways to develop with cutting edge technologies
    Ambitious individual who can work under their own direction towards agreed targets/goals and with creative approach to work
    Intuitive individual with an ability to manage change and proven time management
    Proven interpersonal skills while contributing to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed
    Up-to-date technical knowledge by attending educational workshops, reviewing publications
  
 
 
  
    
    About Business Unit
   IBM’s Cloud and Cognitive software business is committed to bringing the power of IBM’s Cloud and Watson/AI technologies to life for our clients and ecosystem partners around the world. IBM provides you with the most comprehensive and consistent approach to development, security and operations across hybrid environments—with complete software solutions for business and IT operations, development, data science, security, and management. Our experts and software capabilities help organizations develop applications once and deploy them anywhere, integrate security across the breadth of their IT estate, and automate operations with management visibility. With IBM, you also have access to new skills and methods, governance and management approaches, and a deep ecosystem of industry experts and partners.
   
 
 
   This job requires you to be fully COVID-19 vaccinated prior to your start date and proof of vaccination status will be required before your start date. During the Onboarding process you will be asked to confirm your vaccination status, in case you are unable to get vaccinated for any reason, you can let us know at that stage. Please let us know if you are unable to be vaccinated due to medical or religious reasons. IBM will consider such requests on a case by case basis subject to submission of required proof by the candidate before a stipulated date.
 
 
  
    
    Your Life @ IBM
   In a world where technology never stands still, we understand that, dedication to our clients success, innovation that matters, and trust and personal responsibility in all our relationships, lives in what we do as IBMers as we strive to be the catalyst that makes the world work better.
   Being an IBMer means you’ll be able to learn and develop yourself and your career, you’ll be encouraged to be courageous and experiment everyday, all whilst having continuous trust and support in an environment where everyone can thrive whatever their personal or professional background.
   Our IBMers are growth minded, always staying curious, open to feedback and learning new information and skills to constantly transform themselves and our company. They are trusted to provide on-going feedback to help other IBMers grow, as well as collaborate with colleagues keeping in mind a team focused approach to include different perspectives to drive exceptional outcomes for our customers. The courage our IBMers have to make critical decisions everyday is essential to IBM becoming the catalyst for progress, always embracing challenges with resources they have to hand, a can-do attitude and always striving for an outcome focused approach within everything that they do.
   Are you ready to be an IBMer?
 
 
  
    About IBM
   IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that through the application of intelligence, reason and science, we can improve business, society and the human condition, bringing the power of an open hybrid cloud and AI strategy to life for our clients and partners around the world.
   
   Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are not only one of the largest corporate organizations in the world, we’re also one of the biggest technology and consulting employers, with many of the Fortune 50 companies relying on the IBM Cloud to run their business. 
   
   At IBM, we pride ourselves on being an early adopter of artificial intelligence, quantum computing and blockchain. Now it’s time for you to join us on our journey to being a responsible technology innovator and a force for good in the world.
 
 
  
    
    Location Statement

   For additional information about location requirements, please discuss with the recruiter following submission of your application.

   IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. The Role 
 
 
  We are looking for a talented Practice Leader /Capability CenterLeader for Native Software Engineering with great interpersonal skills to join our team. The energy transition is underway and emerging digital technologies are redefining our operating environment. As the home of technical talent for staff and contractors, Information & Digital Engineering (IDE) sits at the heart of Shell’s response to this changing landscape. Offering various capabilities spanning a broad range of technical, analytical, and strategic expertise, we provide our employees with plenty of opportunities to shape the energy transition and have a positive impact in the wider world. With us, you can grow your career, gain certifications, develop leading-edge skills, and deepen your business knowledge in an environment that’s collaborative, supportive and fun. As a growing team, our internal customers access our skills because of our focus on improvement, expertise, experience, and continuous learning.
   IDE organization offers a unique opportunity for you to make an impact across a complex integrated energy value chain serving all lines of business in the Group. You could be creating new customer services in the largest Lubricants business globally, or innovating ways to grow an Aviation business which refuels five aircrafts every minute. With Shell investing significantly in renewables, there will be several opportunities to power our green engine too.
  
   Native Software Engineering within IDE is the home for Software Engineers to collaborate and develop scalable solutions that accelerate business value, opening new possibilities for Shell. We apply deep engineering skills within a vibrant global community of natural teams, passionate about investing in people. We build commercial, production-ready software. By keeping our solutions on the right track, we gain the trust of our stakeholders and the freedom to break new ground when tackling the challenges of tomorrow.
  
   The Practice Leader / Capability Centre Leader for Native Software Engineering will play a key role in Shell IT’s mission of delivering value differentiating products to Shell’s businesses globally. This technical leadership role aims to deepen Shell’s development capability in all parts of the backend stack, be it DevOps, Databases, Backend logic or front end. You will be responsible to support in driving the vision for software engineering technologies and processes across Shell and leading high-performance engineering teams to deliver customer-centric, value enabling business outcomes. A key aspect of your role will be recruit and develop talent from within the local market, consult with various businesses around potential cloud-native solutions to be developed.
  
   Objectives: -
  
    Build, nurture and grow high performance teams using Agile Engineering principles
    Act as a people and technical leader sharing own experience, insights and energy, adopting a hands-on approach where needed
    Set capability build and technical agenda for team members across the globe
    Keep up to the ever increasing demand from business by hiring right practitioners for the right job and retain / develop existing high performing team members
  
   Traits: -
  
    Thrives in uncertainty
    Get energy from motivating others to success
    Customer obsessed
    Empathetic to human psychology and aspects
    Places value in design to solve customer problems
    Proven excellent communication skills internally and externally to management levels and a broad range of stakeholders at all levels of the organisation
    High emotional intelligence, integrity and trustworthiness
  
  
   Experience
  
    Seasoned Leader having 14-18years of hands on experience in Design, Development and Implementation of scalable cloud-based web and mobile applications.
    Significant domain experience in one or more of the business areas in energy sector (downstream, upstream, integrated gas, energy trading, renewables & energy solutions).
    Experience in Global role managing geographically distributed teams.
    The CC Lead is expected to Lead and collaborate across other IT natural teams (Business IT, Architect, ITSO).
    Lead and inspire a team of Software Engineers in the US, Europe & India to deliver world class services
    Champion the native software engineering discipline across the organisation and drive excellence across our on-prem and cloud services
    Proven technology leadership experience in broader Microsoft and other technology stack and related frameworks & technologies (.NET Core, ASP.NET MVC, WPF, React, Node, Xamarin etc).    Job Title
 
  Lead Database Engineer
  Job Description Summary
  [Overview]
  
 
  Provide world-class support and expertise to all of MasterCard’s NoSQL database environments.
  MasterCard’s Database Architects set the direction for the enterprise leadership to design and build highly available, scalable and efficient NoSQL database solutions.
  Represent MasterCard’s Data Architecture team as a subject matter expert in the NoSQL sub domain.
  Continually look for opportunities to create efficiencies and provide expertise to integrate technologies and platforms into current environments within the NoSQL sub domain.
  Provide leadership and contribute to technology roadmaps to support MasterCard’s vision for all NoSQL technologies.
  What technologies do you have hands-on experience with, and what degree is that experience?
  In your current role, what new database technologies have you integrated into your current environment and how?
  What experience do you have with data migration and integration from multiple systems?
 
  [Role]
  
 
  Excellent interpersonal communication skills.
  Forward thinking infrastructure automation and scripting skills.
  Leads in managing clients expectations and communicates proactively.
  Displays excellent collaborative skills to facilitate cross-functional teams.
  Ability to work with team members located in multiple geographies and time zones.
  Ability to work with minimal supervision seeking direction as required.
  The NoSQL DBA will be responsible for designing, deploying and maintaining NOSQL database clusters that will enable and enhance software products and systems used every day by large platforms, applications and groups of users.
  The DBA should have advanced knowledge of some industry standard NoSQL databases such as (MongoDB, Cassandra, Redis, etc.) Including creation and implementation of fully functional NoSQL database clusters, ability to maintain multiple development, QA and production NoSQL environments with strong experience in performance tuning.
  Review existing configurations and installations and provide design decisions for improvements to platform environments.
  Assist in planning and performing NoSQL database upgrades and migrations.
  Responsible for providing day-to-day administration support and maintenance for existing and new NoSQL databases.
  Perform production level support and be part of the on call rotation when required.
  Work with NoSQL vendors and their respected support channels when required.
  This position will be responsible for supporting new and existing NoSQL database systems, both internally and future Cloud managed instances and will help guide best practices in database administration, and introduce innovation with automation.
  Work with multiple application teams and developers.
  Lead and set direction for MasterCard’s use of best practices and application NoSQL database solutions.
  Work with management to plan and implement new strategies including new tools and products that provide data services.
  Assist in implementing long-term strategic goals for database development in conjunction with end users, managers, clients, and other stakeholders.
  Implement HA solutions and define backup/recovery strategies.
  Identify inefficiencies in current databases and implement improved solutions.
 
  Education (preferred):
  
 
  Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information systems or equivalent experience.
 
  [About You]
  
 
  Requires 5-8 years of related experience in the design, maintenance, and administration of NOSQL databases (Mongo, Cassandra, Redis, etc.).
  Excellent trouble shooting skills.
  Any previous experience with Big-Data Platforms like Hadoop or Apache Spark will be incredibly valuable.
  Previous SQL Server and/or Oracle or PostgreSQL database administration experience is a definite plus.
  Perform debugging, tuning and performance enhancement as well as automation of operational and continuous integration aspect of the NOSQL platform.
  Proficient with the Linux operating system, specifically Oracle Linux Enterprise.
  Working knowledge of Data Modelling.
  Working knowledge of scripting languages, Bash, ksh, perl etc.
 
 
 
   Corporate Security Responsibility
   All activities involving access to Mastercard assets, information, and networks comes with an inherent risk to the organization and, therefore, it is expected that every person working for, or on behalf of, Mastercard is responsible for information security and must:
 
 
   Abide by Mastercard’s security policies and practices;
   Ensure the confidentiality and integrity of the information being accessed;
   Report any suspected information security violation or breach, and
   Complete all periodic mandatory security trainings in accordance with Mastercard’s guidelines.

WHAT YOU'LL DO
  Join a team of data engineers and architects who are at the forefront of transforming the BCG’sdata landscape. We are currently building a centralized Data Lake that will simplify and automate data delivery, providing advanced insights and analytics to support decision-making across the organization. Our goal is to empower business leaders with the information they need to make informed decisions and drive business growth.
  
  The Data Engineer role is a vital member of an Agile team with a focus on delivering advanced business intelligence through data. The role is responsible for designing, building, and maintaining data infrastructure to support data-driven decision-making across the enterprise.
  
  Responsibilities would include:
 
   Designing and implementing data pipelines, data warehousing, and data governance solutions
   Collaborating with data analysts and other stakeholders to understand and support the analytical needs of the business
   Building scalable, high-performance data infrastructure to support analytical and machine learning workloads
   Ensuring data quality and integrity through proper data governance practices
   Participating in Agile development processes and collaborating with cross-functional teams to deliver data-driven insights that support decision-making
 
  YOU'RE GOOD AT
  Data as a concept and DataEngineering
 
   Identifying and defining data engineering problems: Understand business objectives and identify areas where data engineering can help in enabling data for analytics.
   Proposing data engineering solutions with right tools/tech
   Developing and implementing data engineering pipelined:Use analytical insights to design and implement solutions that address data problems, using various coding and data engineering
   methods.
 
  Communication, interpersonal and teaming skills
 
   You work positively and collaboratively with others and within a team, and you build strong and lasting relationships
   You adapt your style to changing situations and audiences with tact, poise, and patience.
   You should be comfortable connecting & engaging with people across cultures, backgrounds and geographies within BCG
   You ask the right questions, share ideas within &across projects with an analytical mindset
 
  Work Management, organization, and planning
 
   Must be able to perform successfully in a fast-paced, intellectually intense, service-oriented environment
   You will be working in an Agile environment
   Strong Organizational skills
   Ability to prioritize efforts accordingly.
 
  YOU BRING (EXPERIENCE & QUALIFICATIONS)
  Strong understanding of end-to-end data, engineering tasks & responsibilities.
 
   Very good understanding of data as a concept & capabilities of data & analytics platform.
   Should have clear understanding of data warehousing, ETL and data pipeline concepts.
   SQL is heavily used across the team, so having solid understanding of it is crucial to success in this role.
   Good understanding & exposure to cloud platforms i.e., AWS.
   Snowflakeexperience is preferred as the MPP technology is widely used across the organization.
   As a college graduate, it is important to have a strong understanding of computer science fundamentals, data structure and algorithms.
   Strong programming skills in Python, PySpark or Scala.
   Understanding of data modelling and data governancebest practices.
   Ability to write new code i.e., well-documented and stored in a version control system (we use GitHub)
   Familiarity with JIRA & Confluence. Process management knowledge is a must.
   Good to have exposure to data-platform technologies such as DBT, Talend, FiveTran, Compose, Apache airflowand Snowflake.
   Strong attention to detail and ability to work with large datasets & complex systems.
   In this role, you’ll collaborate with analysts, senior engineers, product owners and other stakeholders to understand their data needs and implement solutions.
   As a data engineer in our agile organization, you will have the opportunity to work on a variety of projects, use advanced technologies and be a part of a team that values adaptability, flexibility, and continuous improvement.
   Strong communication skills. 
 
  
 YOU'LL WORK WITH

This includes, but is not limited to Local, Regional, Global teams. Being part of the Global Data Tribe team, coordinating and working with our other core product squads will play a large part in this role.

Site Name: Bengaluru Luxor North Tower
  
 Posted Date: Feb 13 2023
  Come join us as we supercharge GSK’s data capability! 
 At GSK we are building a best-in-class data and prediction powered team that is ambitious for patients. 
 
 Scientific Digital and Tech’s goal is to power the discovery, development and supply of medicines and vaccines to patients. This means new tools to discover new medicines and vaccines, predictive capability for pre-clinical research, accelerated CMC and supply chain and an improved day-to-day laboratory experience for our scientists. Our Digital & Tech solutions will automate workflows and speed up decisions; freeing hands and releasing minds to focus on science.
 
  As R&D enters a new era of data driven science, we are building a data engineering capability to ensure we have high quality data captured with context and aligned data models, so that the data is useable and reusable for a variety of use cases. 
 GSK R&D and Digital and Tech’s collective goal is to deliver business impact, including the acceleration of the discovery and development of medicines and vaccines to patients. The R&D Digital and Tech remit has expanded over the past 2 years, and to position GSK for the future, The change will strengthen R&D Tech, to provide more strategic impact, focus, accountability, and improved decision making in the use of Digital, Data and Analytics (DDA) to strengthen the pipeline.
 
  Architecture is a key role in transforming R&D Tech in the modernization strategy and it is an exciting time to be part of the team. The Principal Enterprise Architect, Scientific Digital & Tech is a key role in our journey.
 
  As an Enterprise Architect, you will guide Product teams on technical and information architectures. You will provide leadership to link the business mission, strategy, and processes of GSK R&D research solutions to its IT strategy with plans, models and solutions that ensure the current and future needs of the research organization and IT will be met in an efficient, secure, sustainable, agile, and adaptable manner.
 
  This role will provide you the opportunity to lead key activities to progress your career. These responsibilities include some of the following:
 
   Maintain current knowledge of GSK architecture components as well as our key cloud platforms.
   Ensure architectures defined for systems comply with standards and policies
   Work with product teams by contributing to architecture plans.
   Be an active participant in the Scrum of Scrums and key projects in solution groups.
   Ensure that architecture artefacts and decision-making reflect the GSK wide view and longer-term timeframe when appropriate.
   Align IT to the business to achieve strategies and objectives such as: improved data integration and data quality, simpler and standard architectures.
   Maximise reuse and contribute to the life-cycle of existing standards and services
   Approve architecture and standard exceptions while ensuring each is justifiable.
   Educate key IT and business stakeholders on global and local architecture, the value proposition and alignment with business and IT goals and objectives
   Work with other architects and product teams to align R&D’s operations with IT by improving the IT infrastructure and optimizing business operations.
   Catalog develop, coordinate and communicate enterprise and information architecture models, representations, capabilities, components, and plans in order for R&D Tech to progress their product plans.
   Work with the engineers and product owners to ensure projects align with the strategic target architecture plans as well as help produce effectively designed solutions.
   Embrace the principle of “Loosely Coupled, Highly Cohesive design” to Catalog, Develop, Coordinate and Communicate enterprise and information architectures, representations, capabilities, components, and plans in order for R&D Tech to progress their product plans.
 
 
  Why you?
 
  Basic Qualifications:
 
  We are looking for professionals with these required skills to achieve our goals:
 
   Bachelor’s Degree in computer science, engineering, or similar discipline
   10+ years relevant pharma research experience and / or exposure to enterprise architecture in an IT organization 
  Experience with the pharma research process (Discovery, Product Development and Clinical Trials Supply)
   Track record in successful architecture and design
   Track record in delivering business impact through IT enabled solutions 
  Experience of Agile, DevOps and Automation (Jira, CI/CD, Git, Docker, Kubernetes, etc)

       Why BT?
       We’ve always been an organisation with purpose; to use the power of communications to make a better world. You can trace this back to our beginning as pioneers of the world’s first telecommunications company. At our heart we’re a technology company with research and innovation in our bones and a desire to be personal, simple, and brilliant for our customers - those are the values we live by whilst also creating an inclusive working environment where people from all backgrounds can succeed.
      
     
      Our pursuit of progress over the past 180 years has established BT as a strong, successful brand, with huge scale capable of achieving great things. From supporting emergency services, hospitals, banks and keeping economies around the world online, safe and secure, to delivering large scale technology infrastructure like the creation of BT Sport.
      
     
      Today in this fast changing, always on, digital world our purpose remains true. Yet the market conditions, regulation and competition we face are tougher than ever before. So if you have the drive, optimism and resilience to help propel us forward we’ll offer unrivalled personal development, a wealth of opportunities to learn, experience new things and pursue new careers. If that’s you and what you’re looking for, we’d love you to be part of our future.
      
     
      
       
        
          What you’ll be doing
         
       
       
        
         A skilled designer who will align with HCD principals with a solid understanding of the importance of test-driven development, agile methodologies, API design.

         Get an opportunity to understand billing challenges and requirements which exist across the globe and never have a dull moment. 
         Reviewing Designs produced by junior members of the team and ensuring that those align to the overall direction laid down by Enterprise Architects. 
         Troubleshoot and solve complex business problems with the help of latest tools and technologies. 
         Providing technical knowledge to consult on significant component(s) of a solution, as well as taking responsibility for the overall billing solution. 
         Supporting and coaching a team of high performing design engineers and driving continuous improvement across the team 
        
       
      
      
       
        
         Required Skills
         
       
       
        
         You’re a skilled billing designer, with experience of working in agile environment using HCD principals. 
         Someone who is passionate about solving business problems through a mix of innovative solutions and high quality, secure and performant software 
         You’re proactive about learning 
         You’re proficient with designing solution using at least two COTS products listed here (Oracle Network Mediation, Netcracker’s RBM, Kenan/Arbor, Oracle BRM, Crystal Billing Formatter) 
         You have prior experience of working on billing solutions across a mix of countries. 
         You’re a good communicator, able to advise technical and non-technical stakeholders. 
         
        
         Bonus points for (but not essential):
         
        
         Experience in designing or building applications which can make optimal use of Cloud infrastructure capabilities. 
         Has experience of working on Legal & Regulatory requirements across multiple countries (the more the better) 
         Has good understanding of US Taxation and how to use associated tools like Vertex O-Series.

Platform Enterprise Architecture Specialist 
    
   
  
 
 
  
   
    
     Job Req ID: 11446 
    
   
  
 
 
  
   
    
     Posting Date: 13-Feb-2023 
    
   
  
 
 
  
   
    
     Function: Architecture Solution and Design 
    
   
  
 
 
  
   
    
     Location: RMZ Ecoworld, Devarabeesanahal, Bengaluru, India 
    
   
  
 
 
  
   
    
     Salary: Competitive 
    
   
  
 
 
 
  
   
    
     
      About BT
      
     
      BT has a key role in British society, fostering change and leading technology innovation. From delivering the Olympics, to supporting the emergency services, to investing more into research than any other UK technology company, we take pride in everything we do - and in the people who work here.
       We're now a global company operating at the forefront of the information age, employing 90,000 people in 180 countries. And we're on a mission. Guided by our core values of Personal, Simple and Brilliant our goal is to help customers, communities and businesses overcome barriers and release their potential.
       So, if you're interested in the power of potential, why not join us today and release yours? You can read more here about what it's like to work at BT.
      
     
      
       
        
          Description
         
       
       
        
          At BT Digital we are driving the digital transformation of a top UK brand. We’re creating new experiences for our customers and also entering new markets such as fintech and healthcare.
         
        
         The platform architecture team is leading a change in how BT designs its technology. We are working across all our customer-facing units, and helping them reorganise their technology stack as a set of reusable products. We also help introduce platform thinking into the way BT interacts with its customers and commercial partners.
         
        
         As an enterprise architect in the platform architecture team, you will help BT design the overall platform landscape that enables our offer to our customers.
          For this role we welcome applications from experienced architects, but also from technical business analysts, developers, engineers, or others who wish to move an architecture role.
         
       
      
      
       
        
          What you’ll be doing:
         
       
       
        
         Promote a culture where BT’s technology capabilities are designed as products.
         Ensure best practices are followed in the architecture design of platforms and solutions.
         Identify opportunities for reuse, simplification and productisation within the technology stack.
         Engage with colleagues in multiple teams, learn about their use cases and influence their design work.
         Challenge design work that can benefit from stronger platform-oriented thinking.
         Make architecture recommendations in specific areas such as DevSecOps, payment or identity.
         Coordinate the creation of strategic road maps for implementing platform designs.
         Recommend sensible phasing of complex technical work.
         Review architecture designs produced by colleagues and provide constructive feedback.
         Create high-quality documentation of principles, designs, business cases, and reference/baseline/transitional/target architectures.
        
         
       
      
      
       
        
          What you’ll need: 
        
       
       
        
         Interest in helping BT establish a platform economy around technology products, both internally and externally.
         Confidence in technology design practices, such as loose coupling, service orientation and hybrid cloud.
         A good understanding of how isolated technical capabilities can turn into reusable patterns.
         Ability to lead highly technical discovery work with engineers, solution architects and other stakeholders.
         A methodical approach to handling complex problems in a large organisation.
         Expert-level skills in business analysis.
         A mature understanding of the principles of solution architecture, cloud architecture and data architecture.
         A mature understanding of the principles of software engineering and DevSecOps.
         Ability to learn rapidly and develop expertise in new domain areas.
         Ability to communicate in both the business jargon and the technology jargon, and translate effectively between the two.
         Ability to perform risk assessment and capability gap analysis.
         
       
      
      
       
        
          You should apply if you:
         
       
       
        
         You feel at home communicating with both technical and non-technical colleagues.
         You are recognised by colleagues as creative, collaborative and thought-provoking.
         You can investigate business problems and identify the root cause behind them, considering both business-side and technology-side factors.
         You are a strategic thinker, and have ideas about how to turn bits of technology into reusable products.
         You have worked on the architecture of customer-facing systems, including their front end, application back end and data layer.
         You like problem-solving, simplifying and reorganising.
         You have contributed to architecture plans and technology road maps with multiple phases.
         You have presented options assessments that convinced your colleagues they should support your recommended way forward.
         
       
      
     
     
       Who is the BT Group
       We're the leading communications provider with customers in 180 countries. Across the world we enable customer's digital transformations so they can thrive. our focus is simple: be the global provider-of-choice for managed network and IT infrastructure services..

Who We Are
  Today's ambitious business environment is more than that - it's a period of disruption between the pandemic, global business change and internal process complexity. For us to focus on simplicity and the best customer experience, we need great talent and the right skillsets to be successful. This is now a mantra for our Cisco leadership team and for us.
  The Digital Enterprise Solutions team is changing the way we run Cisco's operations by improving the power of technology, the best of business processes and outstanding data insights. Together, we will Reinvent the Cisco experience. Show the world how to Reinvent applications and demonstrate the future of the Internet to Showcase the power of Cisco: our people, products, processes, systems, and data. Please join us and make this journey together!
  What You'll Do
  We have a phenomenal opportunity for a highly motivated Software engineer to join our team in Digital Enterprise Solutions, Products team responsible for the support, administration and development of Web applications and services for engineering. The successful candidate will join a diversified team providing Web application Development services and application support.
  Responsibilities include:
 
   Works with the business and understand the requirements and able to design Technical architecture.
   Write design specifications and hands-on coding.
   Troubleshooting software issues
   Provide support to local internal clients and assistance in the support of systems.
   Follow standard design and implantation processes and procedures.
   Develop well-defined software modules.
   Perform well-defined unit, product level integration, and development tests.
   Write portions of test plans.
   Participate in code review and quality assurance activities.
   Work closely with peer engineers at other locations such as San Jose, CA and Research Triangle Park, NC.
 
  Who You'll Work With?
  As part of the Digital Enterprise Solutions team, you will be part of Supply Chain Source Organization team, committed to delivering extraordinary services, tools, platforms, and data used to power our Supply Chain. From optimizing/automating Business process systems, to improving cloud service providers, to in-house development using the latest technologies, we are constantly innovating and evolving to give our Supply Chain team the competitive advantage.
  You'll be part of a highly dynamic, empowered and collaborative Team who are passionate about building, supporting and enhancing a lean, mean, efficient and scalable ecosystem.
  Who You Are
  We're seeking a hardworking, expert and self-motivated IT professional who has a real passion for technology. You feel comfortable dealing with ambiguity, and you are able to influence within and outside the organization. Minimum requirements include:
 
   15+ years of experience with databases, full-stack development, design, and technically leading application development.
   BE/B.Tech in Computer Science (or related field).
   Working experience with Java, Web Services, Databases based architecture
   Proficiency in MEAN stack, API management and application integration.
   Experience in developing microservices using any of the following: Angular 2.0, GoLang, Python, Node JS
   Good understanding of Agile and DevSecOps practices and toolsets including daily standups and iteration planning meetings.
   Able to quickly iterate and refine planned features’ backlog based on partners' needs.
   Handle individual project priorities, deadlines, and work
   Experience maintaining and scaling high-volume software systems in an Agile environment
   Ability to understand the needs & challenges of different businesses and industries to build solutions to solve for them at scale
   Proficiency in relational, in-memory and NoSQL databases including Oracle, Snowflake and Mongo
   Positive and self-starter attitude, willingness to participate in team activities to build a constructive and positive team culture that promotes teamwork and innovation
 
  Why Cisco
  #WeAreCisco, where each person is unique, but we bring our talents to work as a team and make a difference powering an inclusive future for all.
  We embrace digital, and help our customers implement change in their digital businesses. Some may think we're "old" (36 years strong) and only about hardware, but we're also a software company. And a security company. We even invented an intuitive network that adapts, predicts, learns and protects. No other company can do what we do - you can't put us in a box!
  But "Digital Transformation" is an empty buzz phrase without a culture that allows for innovation, creativity, and yes, even failure (if you learn from it.)
  Day to day, we focus on the give and take. We give our best, give our egos a break, and give of ourselves (because giving back is built into our DNA.) We take accountability, bold steps, and take difference to heart. Because without diversity of thought and a dedication to equality for all, there is no moving forward.
  So, you have colorful hair? Don't care. Tattoos? Show off your ink. Like polka dots? That's cool. Pop culture geek? Many of us are. Passion for technology and world changing? Be you, with us!

description:
Quest Global is an organization at the forefront of innovation and one of the world’s fastest growing engineering services firms with deep domain knowledge and recognized expertise in the top OEMs across seven industries. We are a twenty-five-year-old company on a journey to becoming a centenary one, driven by aspiration, hunger and humility.
     We are looking for humble geniuses, who believe that engineering has the potential to make the impossible, possible; innovators, who are not only inspired by technology and innovation, but also perpetually driven to design, develop, and test as a trusted partner for Fortune 500 customers.
     As a team of remarkably diverse engineers, we recognize that what we are really engineering is a brighter future for us all. If you want to contribute to meaningful work and be part of an organization that truly believes when you win, we all win, and when you fail, we all learn, then we’re eager to hear from you.
     The achievers and courageous challenge-crushers we seek, have the following characteristics and skills:
     Roles & Responsibilities:
    
      Develop strategic plans for testing efforts
      Create test estimates and define/build reusable testing assets for large/complex projects
      Develop and implement test automation frameworks
      Provide technical leadership and support the creation of complex tests
      Advise the customer on innovative testing products and solutions
      Define and administer standard testing architecture methodologies, processes and tools across all engagements
      Improve quality practices across functional and non-functional testing
      Delivery of complex test programmes
      Support the strategic direction of our Continuous Testing & Assurance Practice
      A strong network and the ability to initiate and maximise new business opportunities
      Work on building strong and effective relationships with clients
      Demonstrate business development experience
      Working on RFPs & mining for new opportunities by pitching technical innovation and quality solutions.
      Have experience in manual testing on Linux based platform, should have capability to deploy and test on Virtual Machine and K8 environment provided by Azure, AWS, Tanzu.
      Tester should have understanding on test deployment on K8 environment, understanding of integration with Cloud platform capability will bring added advantage. 
    
    Required Skills (Technical Competency):
    
      Experience in setting up a test framework from scratch and improving existing frameworks to be more efficient and effective
      Experience in defining and implementing test processes in the organization across multiple projects
      Preliminary exposure and experience in telecom domain and protocols like Diameter, Radius, SOAP/HTTP, SMPP , Web Services, HTTP Rest architecture etc. gives an added advantage. 
     Experience in Software Product/Solution testing (functional, system and performance) in Linux environment and not on Windows. 
     Experience in product testing with tools like Seagull, J-Meter, SOAP UI etc (Selenium, Load Runner, UI automation tools not desired.)
      Working knowledge of databases like Oracle, MySQL, VoltDb, Oracle Timesten is desired
      Experience in performance and load testing of APIs and interfaces is desired but not looking for GUI based load/ performance testing candidates.
      Knowledge/Willingness on Virtualization and Containerization technologies (Docker & Kubernetes) is a very added advantage – We are actively looking for candidates who have exposure on test deployment in K8 setups provided by PaaS platform
      Experience of identifying the appropriate techniques, tools and guidelines to implement the required tests and to give guidance on the corresponding resources requirements for the test effort
      Experience of leading multiple release cycles
      Must understand technologies such as web servers, application servers, databases (SQL & Oracle)
      Must have strong understanding of scripting/programming/computer architecture with proven experience in at least one language like Java, Javascript.
      Possess a track record of successful managing highly complex test programmes on schedule, to budget and quality standards
      Experience of the full software project lifecycle (waterfall, agile, DevOps) and a technical appreciation of IT systems and solutions.
      Good Understanding of Design patterns and principals in building Test Solutions.
      Expertise in working on UI automation tools like but not limited to Selenium, TestNG, WebdriverIO, Playwright, etc.
      Expertise in working on mobile and desktop application testing with knowledge of automation using tools such as Appium, WebdriverIO, perfecto, Winnium, etc.
      Expertise in working on API testing and automation tools such as but not limited to Postman, Karate API, Rest-Assured, etc.
      Expertise in working on Performance Testing with experience with tools such as JMeter, Gatling or Load Runner.
      Understanding of Big data Analytics pipelines including data ingestion models, data lakes and storage on data warehouses.
      Knowledge on CI CD pipelines and build tools such as Jenkins, Azure Devops, Maven.
      Good understanding in databases, SQL.
      Knowledge of cloud-based integrations such as AWS EC2, Azure VM's, S3, etc
      Excellent problem solving and analytical skills
      Proven experience in managing test tools and environments to support test programmes
      Has delivered test maturity assessments, providing and successfully implementing an improvements plan
      Good communication in English (oral & written) & Interpersonal skills. Customer focus - ability to build and develop customer & supplier relationships
      Organisational agility
      Problem solving ability
      Results driven outlook
    
     Desired Skills:
    
      Nice to have knowledge of container technology such as Docker and Kubernetes
      Nice to have cloud certifications such as AWS Practitioner or Azure Developer.
      Have a passion for testing, technology and innovation combined with an interest in consultin
      Exceptionally motivated, driven and dynamic
      Demonstrable alignment to our values
      Strong problem-solving skills
      Excellent mathematical and analytical skills
      Excellent facilitation skills
      Able to work independently
      Strong problem-solving skills
      Excellent oral, presentation and competent business writing skills
      Must be comfortable working with all levels of company hierarchy
      Ability to work in ambiguous situations and seek to add clarity and context to work being undertaken
      A desire to continue to develop both personally and professionally
    
    
  
  
   Job Type 
   
    Full Time-Regular 
   
  
  
   Experience Level 
   
    Senior Level 
   
  
  
   Total Years of Exp 
   
    12+

Job Description Tech Ops Engineer
  Location: [Bangalore, India]
  Format: Remote
  Job Vaccination Requirement: No
 
  WONDERING WHAT’S WITHIN DANAHER? TAKE A CLOSER LOOK. 
 
 At first glance, you’ll see Danaher’s scale. With $22.3B revenue, our 69,000 associates work across the globe at more than 25 unique operating companies within four platforms — life sciences, diagnostics, water quality, and product identification.
 
  Career development is important to us - you’ll find associates who are as certain about their impact as they are about where they’re headed next. You’ll find the Danaher Business System, which makes everything possible. You’ll also see a company that investors trust—our culture of continuous improvement has helped us outperform the S&P 500 by more than 5,000% over the past 25 years.
 
  We hope you’ll see yourself here, too. What you find at Danaher — and within yourself — might just change the world.
 
  WHO WE ARE: 
 
 ESKO is a global provider of integrated software and hardware solutions that accelerate the go-to-market process of packaged goods. For each stakeholder in the process, Esko solutions enable them to deliver right-first-time packaging and marketing content.
 
  WITHIN YOUR TEAM
  Collaboration with client on various system component and microservices to define CI/CD automation pipeline, target environments , closely work with various teams to have understanding on needed software and provision the same for application hosting on various VMs by working closely with system admin and procurement team, making the environment deployment ready to host the mission critical applications and necessary configuration trimming as well as compliance conflict resolution , Proactively monitor, identify and escalate issues or root causes of systemic issues . Incidence management and root cause analysis. Bringing stakeholders, applications owners, software, infrastructure requirement, processes , development and testing team all together to get the work done.
 
  THIS JOB IS A UNIQUE OPPORTUNITY TO: 
 
 Explore your true potential by having the accessibility to the modern cloud infrastructure business model and practices. You get to work closely with all the spheres within the Cloud Organization exploring more about various roles played by your fellow colleagues.
 
  WITHIN YOUR ROLE, YOU WILL:
 
   Participate in planning, implementation, and growth of the infrastructure on Amazon Web Services (AWS) and other cloud platforms as required
   Manage full application stacks from the OS through custom applications using Amazon cloud-based computing environments
   Work closely with Architects, Project Managers and Engineers to design networks, systems, and storage environment that effectively reflect business needs, security requirements, and service level requirements
   Manage a continuous integration/continuous deployment methodology for the server-based technologies
   Cloud infrastructure Cost optimization and right-sizing to help the products get the best value from their cloud investments
   Setting up CI/CD pipelines to for fully automated deployments of infrastructure
   Setting up Cloud infrastructure Observability/Monitoring using Application Insight / Azure Monitor / Datadog / PagerDuty and the Cloud Center of Exellence own Centralized Monitoring Solution
   Ensure products are following DevOps recommended practices and execution.
   Guide products to achieve High-Availability and Disaster Recovery in a cloud context
   Expertise in Linux and Windows Server system administration.
   Monitoring of mission critical applications on prod and non servers
   Engaging with NOC team and other stakeholder for troubleshooting on various applications infrastructure monitoring alerts
   Troubleshooting for applications and services on Aws cloud
   JIRA and ServiceNow expertise for ticketing and project scrum activities
   AWS SysOps and ITIL certifications are preferred and a plus
   Experience in Change and Incident management
   This role is 24*7 support
 
 
  WE ARE LOOKING FOR A PROFESSIONAL WHO IS:
 
   Excellent Listening Skills – the ability to interpret customer needs based on brief conversations and manage available time and expectations
   Excellent Communicator - actively adjust presenting and teaching methodologies based on each customer’s needs
   Self-Motivated – can focus their energy and efforts towards achieving success and proactively solving problems, while continuously increasing skillsets through training as well as self-paced study
   Organized – able to manage multiple calendars and communication methods to attend all necessary meetings and events consistently and punctually
   Customer-Oriented - relationship savvy who makes connections with both internal partners and external customers
 
 
  OUR CORE VALUES: 
 
  Choose 1 paragraph only
 
 
  At Danaher, we’re driven by a sense of wonder for what we can create—and what we can become. Here, you’ll accelerate your career while driving innovation that improves lives. You’ll work hard and take risks, with guidance from committed leaders, powerful DBS tools, and the support of a global organization. If you’d like to learn more, read stories from our associates on our Careers Blog or reach out to one of our recruiters.
 
  Our Shared Purpose – Helping Realize Life’s Potential – expresses our reason for being and the impact that every one of us at Danaher strives to have on the world. Our Core Values define the fundamental beliefs that guide our actions. The Core Behaviours* enable our values and Shared Purpose, powered by DBS as our proven system for achieving success at Danaher.
 
  YOUR EDUCATION AND BACKGROUND EXPERIENCE WILL INCLUDE: 
 
  Please specify what is required and what is preferred.
 
 
 
   BE/B.Tech with 2-5 years of experience working in modern day deployment tools in a Cloud Environment like Jenkins and GitHub and thorough understanding of ticketing tools like Jira, Service Now, Confluence etc.
   Knowledge of CI/CD pipelines, Git, Github, Bitbucket, AWS cloud core services EC2, IAM, VPC, S3, EKS, ECR and Route53
   Experience in designing and building web application environments on AWS, including services such as EC2, S3, ELB, RDS, EKS, etc
   Experience with Linux and Windows Server system administration
   Experience with installing and configuring application servers such as Tomcat
   Proficient in developing scripts and scripting languages
   A team player capable of high performance, flexibility in a dynamic working environment and the ability to lead
   Skill and ability to train others on technical and procedural topics
   AWS and ITIL certifications are preferred and a plus
   This role will be for 24*7 support
 
 
  OUR BENEFITS:
 
   We offer you an employee bonus based on business success as well as annual salary review 
  Company pension, accident insurance and preventive healthcare (medical, dental, and visual) on day 1
   Training and development opportunities
   401K savings plan
   Tuition reimbursement from Day 1
   Attractive employee referral programme
   Paid Maternity & paternity pay
   Employee events, sports, and social clubs
   Danaher Wellbeing Program, with rewards
   Employee Assistance Program (legal, financial, and counselling resources)
 
 
  You can find detailed information at https://www.danaherbenefitsinfo.com/. *US ONLY
 
  OUR OFFER: 
 
  Choose 1 paragraph
 
 
  If you are a driven high achiever, you will work with committed, like-minded people, giving you the support to reach your full potential. At Danaher, your potential is amplified. Our culture of continuous improvement defines who we are, drives our success, and translates to a career without limits for our team of 65,000 intellectually curious associates. Listen to our voices: https://jobs.danaher.com/global/en/our-difference.
 
  UNSOLICITED ASSISTANCE
  We do not accept unsolicited assistance from any headhunters or recruitment firms for any of our job openings. All resumes or profiles submitted by search firms to any employee at any of the Product Identification Platform companies, including Videojet Technologies, X-Rite/Pantone, Esko, Alltec-Foba, Laetus and Linx, in any form without a valid, signed search agreement in place for the specific position, will be deemed the sole property of the Operating Company. No fee will be paid in the event the candidate is hired by Operating Company as a result of the unsolicited referral.

Are you looking for an engineering role where you can make a difference in the World? Join our Team to advance VMware’s sustainability innovation! Our 2030 Agenda is a high priority for VMware. We are recruiting talented and passionate engineers to develop solutions — that help our customers decarbonize their multi-cloud operations — through increased productive utilization of their cloud environments and renewable energy-powered workloads. You can learn more about this here.
 
 
 
   We are seeking a Senior Software Developer (Senior Member of Technical Staff)who loves working on complex problems and getting things done. Your work will shape the first generation of VMware’s Sustainability services. As a member of our team, you will play a key role in understanding customer use cases and defining the end–to-end solution. You will build SaaS microservices on the VMC platform, VMware’s flagship hybrid cloud solution. You will help build services to give customers visibility into the carbon footprint of their cloud operations and ways to reduce that footprint using VMware products.
 
 
 
  
    Success in the Role: What are the goals over the first 6 months you will work on ?
  
  
   
     Become familiar with VMware’s ESG goals, strategic priorities, and technology roadmap.
     Learn about sustainability projects including architecture, core components and deliverables by each sub-team.
     Execute on quarterly deliverables including collaboration across sub-teams.
     Contribute to prototype delivery and VMworld demonstration.
   
  
 
 
 
  
    What type of work will you be doing? What assignments, requirements, or skills will you be performing on a regular basis?
  
  
   
     Work in multi-functional agile teams to regularly experiment, iterate, and deliver on new product objectives — by participating in all phases of the software development cycle, as part of a Scrum team
     Take responsibility for the end-to-end test case specification, design, implementation, and automation of key product features.
     Collaborate with other engineers to architect, design, implement and integrate new and enhanced features with the highest possible quality.
     Produce automation suites to support long-term maintainability and extensibility of code in a large-scale multi-tenant SaaS environment
     Obsess over quality in the product, identify trends in product quality and adapt to improve testing and development practices of your team. Explore adoption of new technologies and best practices in both design and test.
   
  
 
 
  
     Required Qualifications:
  
 
 
  
   
     BA/BS or above in Computer Science or equivalent experience.
     3+ years of strong industry development/automation experience in Java and knowledge of OO language
     Hands on experience in Java is a Must.
     Strong conceptual knowledge of Computer Science fundamentals.
     Experience using and developing distributed systems.
     Experience using and developing for scalability and performance, and designing/integrating large-scale systems.
     Knowledge of VMware vSphere, VROps, VMC.
     Good understanding of Docker containers, K8s clusters/pods.
     Experience with continuous integration and continuous deployment, Knowledge of devops tools like Jenkins, and source code management tools like GitLab, Advanced familiarity with Linux OS and developing Shell scripts for configuration, deployment and validation of systems.
   
  
 
 
 
  
    Preferred Experience:
  
  
   
     Expertise in analyzing and troubleshooting large-scale distributed systems
     Able to prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment.
   
  
 
  Category : Engineering and Technology Subcategory: Software Engineering Experience: Manager and Professional Full Time/ Part Time: Full Time Posted Date: 2023-02-13
  VMware Company Overview: At VMware, we believe that software has the power to unlock new opportunities for people and our planet. We look beyond the barriers of compromise to engineer new ways to make technologies work together seamlessly. Our cloud, mobility, and security software form a flexible, consistent digital foundation for securely delivering the apps, services and experiences that are transforming business innovation around the globe. At the core of what we do are our people who deeply value execution, passion, integrity, customers, and community. Shape what’s possible today at http://careers.vmware.com.
  
  Equal Employment Opportunity Statement: VMware is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Prohibits Discrimination and Harassment of Any Kind: VMware is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at VMware are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV Status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. VMware will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. VMware encourages applicants of all ages. Vmware will provide reasonable accommodation to employees who have protected disabilities consistent with local law.
